alert.note: Alert for Atoka (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 8:57PM CDT until June 09 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Clear Boggy Creek near Caney affecting Atoka County.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC005-081400- /O.NEW.KOUN.FL.Y.0023.220608T0157Z-220609T0600Z/ /CANO2.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 857 PM CDT Tue Jun 7 2022 ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Clear Boggy Creek near Caney. * WHEN...From this evening to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, The creek remains mostly within its banks in western Atoka County and the northeastern edge of Bryan County. Some high stages on small feeder streams result in very localized... short-term overflows of mainstem bottomlands. Low-lying fields are briefly cut off from easy access. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 19.4 feet. - Forecast...The Clear Boggy Creek is expected to rise to a crest of 24.1 feet tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
